description: Job Title: Project for Senior Personalization Engine Developer AI/ML Specialist Project Type: Fixed-Price Contract Deadline: 2-4 weeks About Mozaik App: Mozaik is an innovative platform dedicated to delivering personalized content and experiences to our diverse user base. We aim to redefine how users interact with content by tailoring recommendations to individual preferences, behaviors, and demographics. Project Description: We are seeking a highly experienced Freelance Senior Personalization Engine Developer to customize and enhance our existing personalization engine. We will provide the base code, which is already developed and accessible on GitHub. Your task will be to tailor the engine to suit our specific needs according to our detailed instructions and scope. This is a freelance contract position with a fixed-rate fee for the entire project and a strict deadline for completion. Project Scope and Responsibilities: • Code Customization: Utilize our existing base code to customize and enhance the personalization engine, aligning it with our specific requirements. • Understand Project Requirements: Review our detailed instructions and scope documents to fully grasp the customization needed. • Algorithm Enhancement: Modify and improve the existing algorithms to better suit factors like genre, age, location, and other user preferences. • System Integration: Ensure seamless integration of the customized engine with our existing backend systems, APIs, and databases (Backend Tech Stack: Laravel 10, MySQL). • Performance Optimization: Optimize the engine for enhanced performance and scalability to handle large datasets and high traffic volumes efficiently. • Testing and Validation: Conduct comprehensive testing to ensure all customizations meet the required functionalities and performance standards. • Documentation: Update existing documentation or create new documentation detailing the customizations made, including code changes and maintenance guidelines. • Deadline Compliance: Complete all customizations and deliver the final product within the agreed-upon strict deadline. Required Skills and Qualifications: • Extensive Experience: Minimum of 7+ years in software development, with a strong focus on personalization systems and recommendation engines. • Technical Proficiency: Expert-level proficiency in PHP and the Laravel framework. • GitHub Familiarity: Strong experience with GitHub for code management and collaboration. • Algorithm Expertise: Deep understanding of personalization algorithms and data science techniques, such as collaborative filtering, content-based filtering, and hybrid models. • Data Management: Proficient in MySQL and experienced in handling large-scale data storage and retrieval. • Customization Skills: Ability to read, understand, and modify existing codebases efficiently. • Problem-Solving: Exceptional analytical skills to adapt the base code to meet new requirements effectively. • Independent Work Ethic: Capable of working independently, managing time effectively, and meeting strict deadlines. Preferred Qualifications: • Real-Time Personalization: Experience in implementing real-time data processing within existing systems. • User Segmentation: Knowledge of user segmentation strategies to enhance personalization efforts. • Advanced Technologies: Familiarity with natural language processing (NLP), machine learning, or video/mozaik recognition technologies. • A/B Testing: Experience in integrating A/B testing methodologies into existing platforms. Project Timeline: • Project Start Date: ASAP • Project Completion Deadline: 2-4 weeks Payment Terms: • Fixed-Price Contract: Please provide your flat-rate fee bid for the entire project based on the scope of customization required. • Payment Schedule: Payment milestones can be negotiated based on project phases (e.g., initial customization, integration, testing, final delivery). • Invoice Submission: Invoices to be submitted upon completion of each agreed milestone. How to Apply - if selected as a candidate you will be REQUIRED TO DO A VIDEO INTERVIEW with our Senior Dev Manager. Please submit the following: 1. Flat-Rate Fee Bid: Your total fixed-price bid for the entire project. 2. Cover Letter: A brief cover letter explaining your experience with personalization engines, code customization, and relevant technologies. 3. Portfolio/Work Samples: Links to your portfolio, demos, or previous work where you have customized existing systems or engines. 4. Project Approach and Timeline: A detailed summary of how you plan to approach the customization of our base code, including tools, techniques, and a proposed timeline that aligns with the strict deadline. 5. Availability Confirmation: Confirmation of your availability to start immediately and commit fully to meeting the project deadline. Selection Criteria: • Expertise and Experience: Demonstrated expertise in customizing and enhancing personalization engines. • Quality of Work: Evidence of high-quality work in modifying existing codebases. • Adherence to Deadline: Proven ability to deliver complex customizations within strict deadlines. • Competitive Bid: A fair and competitive flat-rate fee for the project. • Communication Skills: Strong communication skills and responsiveness throughout the project. Additional Information: • Access to Base Code: Upon signing a non-disclosure agreement (NDA), you will be granted access to our GitHub repository containing the base code. • Support and Collaboration: While you will work independently, our team will be available to provide necessary guidance and answer any questions related to the existing code and desired customizations. • Scope Details: A comprehensive scope document outlining all customization requirements will be provided at the start of the project.
title: Video feed recommendation engine developer ( AI/ML Specialist)

description: Job description Are you ready to revolutionize fintech and be a superhero for businesses? VeriFee is on a mission to disrupt the payments industry, fighting predatory fees that harm companies and consumers alike. As one of Miami’s fastest-growing fintech startups, we lead the charge in treasury cost reductions and are seeking a dynamic Office, Operations & Billing Manager to join our team! Who We Are At VeriFee, transparency and fairness are at the heart of everything we do. By leveraging cutting-edge AI and expert consultancy, we illuminate hidden fees and protect businesses’ hard-earned profits. Our solutions don’t cost companies upfront; instead, we empower them to save long-term. Think of us as a financial justice league, advocating for fairer payment practices while reducing consumer surcharges. Operating remotely with a Miami Beach backdrop, we combine the flexibility of remote work with the camaraderie of beachside team meetings and occasional island retreats. Join us in reshaping the financial landscape for good. Position Overview: We are seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented manager to join our growing team. In this role, you will manage client relationships, follow up on requests, and work on complex billing projects to ensure accurate and timely monthly invoices for our clients. This position offers the potential to transition into a full office management role and evolve into a long-term executive position within the company. This pivotal role partners directly with our CEO, COO and operational staff, streamlining operations, driving client success, and advancing our proprietary technology. Responsibilities: Billing Process Optimization Analyze and revamp current Zoho Billing processes to align with our unique structure. Implement and manage metered subscription billing models to ensure accuracy and efficiency. Work closely with daily statement analysis, optimization and reporting to our customers. Design automated monthly billing workflows integrating Zoho and Stripe for ACH-only payments. Client Advocacy & Success Serve as the first point of contact for billing inquiries. Enhance onboarding processes to create raving fans. Operations & Optimization Collaborate with leadership to streamline workflows, automate processes, and manage daily operations. Manage billing systems and resolve any discrepancies with vendors. Follow up with clients and their vendors to ensure timely and accurate payments. Assist with general administrative duties, including answering phones, managing client files, and helping to organize meetings. Own and execute cross-departmental initiatives, ensuring progress and KPI alignment using tools like ClickUp. Software Enhancement Collaboration Provide actionable insights to refine our proprietary platform and Zoho CRM integration. What We’re Looking For Required Skills Background in finance, great with numbers Background in startups or small tech companies is highly preferred. Advanced MS Excel skills Expertise in Zoho Books/Billing with a strong background in subscription billing and accounts receivable. Experience integrating Zoho with Stripe for ACH-only payment processing. Strong project management abilities and familiarity with tools like ClickUp. Analytical mindset with attention to detail. Excellent communication skills and adaptability to startup environments. Preferred Qualifications Proven experience in client relationship management, preferably in fintech or related industries. Degree in finance or accounting background. SaaS experience or familiarity with subscription billing models. Proven success in revenue operations and billing automation. PMP certification or similar project management credentials. Familiarity with AI technology and payment processing is a plus. Key Metrics for Success Billing Accuracy: Reduction in discrepancies and improvement in timelines. Efficiency Gains: Percentage of automated processes and workflow improvements. Client Satisfaction: Positive feedback on billing support and onboarding. Project Completion Rates: Timely execution of key projects, enhancing billing and RevOps. KPI Performance: Achieving operational and financial benchmarks. Compensation & Benefits Salary: 90-day trial period (independent contractor), with performance-based salary increases. Benefits: Optional health, dental and vision. Bonuses: KPI-linked incentives for project completion and operational improvements. Perks: Wellness bonuses, PTO, company retreats, and more. Growth Opportunities: Potential for leadership roles, equity ownership, and long-term career advancement. Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $55,000.00 per year Benefits: Flexible schedule Paid time off
title: Operations, Billing & Office Manager

description: Title: Design & Develop a Streamlined Excel-Based Playbook for a Plumbing Business Description: I am looking for an experienced Excel developer with strong VBA and automation skills to redesign and develop a streamlined version of my current "MDP Playbook" for a plumbing business. The goal is to create a user-friendly, efficient, and modern Excel workbook that reduces clunkiness while maintaining its core functionalities. Current Playbook Overview: The Playbook is a tool for managing and pricing plumbing services. It contains 31 sheets, including pricing categories, time & material breakdowns, service offerings, and admin tools. VBA macros and code are used for automation and calculations. What I Need: Redesign the Structure: Simplify the layout and reduce redundancy. Combine related sheets where appropriate. Create an intuitive navigation system (e.g., a main menu or dashboard). Streamline Functionality: Optimize VBA coding for speed and reliability. Ensure macros and formulas work seamlessly. Add user prompts, dropdowns, or other tools to simplify data entry. Modernize Appearance: Use professional formatting with clear fonts, consistent colors, and easy-to-read layouts. Implement conditional formatting where necessary. Maintain Core Features: Support for pricing categories (e.g., drain cleaning, appliances, water heaters, etc.). Flexibility for custom categories and temporary sheets. Compatibility with various plumbing service software, such as FieldPulse, ServiceTitan, and HouseCall Pro. Optimize for Scalability: The Playbook should accommodate future updates or additional categories without requiring significant redesign. Deliverables: A fully functional, streamlined Excel workbook with all required features. Clear and organized VBA code with documentation/comments for future edits. A brief user guide explaining the workbook’s main features and how to use it effectively. Ideal Candidate: Proven experience with Excel VBA development. Background in creating tools for business management, pricing, or service industries. Strong communication skills to discuss requirements and provide updates during the project. Deadline: Completion within 2-3 weeks from project acceptance. Budget: I’m open to quotes, but please include your pricing along with examples of similar projects you’ve worked on.
title: Create Excel Spreadsheet using VBA and macros

description: Labor Category: Specialist 3 Work Location: Primary location: 1 Centre St, New York, NY 10007 Secondary Location: Various DCAS 55 buildings where work is required or Needed Projected Assignment Start Date: January 1, 2025 Projected Assignment End Date: August 7, 2026 IT Consultant for Network Infrastructure Job Description Justification: Our Client Network Infrastructure and Telecommunication team in NYC provides for the sustained, efficient, and effective delivery of network infrastructure, and telecommunications to enhance service delivery to the employees, and partners. The team manages a highly complex network and telecommunication at Central office, 1 Centre Street and 55+ Satellite sites throughout the five boroughs and manages/supports network for over 3000 employees. The team is in the process of refreshing the infrastructure with modern hardware and solutions at its satellite sites. The team will be required to perform fieldwork, visiting the various DCAS-managed buildings to replace the hardware, where necessary. The team must work at 40+ sites replacing close to 150 networks hardware and connections. (Please see Exhibit A for DCAS 40+ sites.) These sites house our client’s staff who support NYS Courts, borough halls and other city agencies. Currently the network hardware at these satellite sites are over 10 years old and End of Life (EoL). Along with this, the software support has expired for these devices, and they are susceptible to vulnerabilities. A downtime on these devices will block communication to these sites and will have operational impacts such as building maintenance, building engineering support and reachability to DCAS Police desks at these locations. With the existing IT Network resources and infrastructure response team, who are the first point of contact for issues impacting various business partners, our client will fall short of balanced day-to-day operation and site upgrade tasks. SCOPE OF SERVICES The consultant will be performing highly technical responsibilities at varying levels of difficulty and with varying degrees of latitude for independent initiative and judgment. Responsibilities will not be limited to upgrading the network infrastructure at our client’s various sites but taking charge on the day-to-day network and telecommunication issues, which involve critical thinking and problem solving in concert with the utilization of industry standard best practices. Scheduled Work Hours: Normal business hours Monday-Friday 35 hours/week (not including mandatory unpaid meal break after 6 hours of work). Days/hours of the week will change if after hour/weekend work is scheduled for the upgrade and deployment. (Weekly hours will be adjusted accordingly) TASKS: • Work with Network infrastructure and Telecommunication team leader for upgrading network, implementing wireless solution (Meraki & Cisco) and their support/troubleshooting. • Work on Cisco Catalyst, Nexus switches and Cisco VoIP devices. • Implement protocols such as: EIGRP, BGP SSH, TCP/IP, UDP, SSL, HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, routing protocols, L2/L3 switches, VPC, 802.1Q, ether-channel, STP, RSTP, VTP, QoS, ACLs, FTP, DNS, SIP and other common protocols. • Implement security products firewalls, IPSec, RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1. • Data gathering of land line at various DCAS buildings where VoIP will be deployed. • Design of the LAN considering legacy equipment integration/upgrade needs. Upgrading might include patching from patch panel to network device. • Consultant will be managing the deployment process as follows: • Unpack the equipment and perform an initial inventory of each item, ensuring that all components are accounted for before beginning the installation. • Rack all equipment at each site. • Remove debris from each location. • Connect power cords to switch and power outlet and confirm power to unit. • Connect cables as per Vendor spreadsheet for all network devices. • Document the equipment onto an inventory spreadsheet. • Provide documentation via inventory spreadsheet. • Import asset to DCAS asset inventory system. • Design recommendations based on CISCO best practice methodology. • Project planning for the implementation, maintenance window. • Consultant must be willing to travel to various DCAS buildings across 5 boroughs for data gathering, network deployment and troubleshooting. • Tasks may include network management, monitoring and troubleshooting tools (sniffer, syslog, NetFlow, TCPDUMP, Wireshark). • Day to Day configuration, management, and operations of Cisco Firepower firewalls, ISE, Stealthwatch and DNAC. • Use Cisco Command line interface, Windows, OSX and Linux • In certain instances, consultant may be asked to assist in troubleshooting beyond the normal work hours. • Expected to document networks, network systems, MOPs and other documents that can be used as operational materials. • Conduct network and security assessments to troubleshoot and optimize network performance and design. Support and lead efforts of the design, testing, evaluation and implementation of new architectures and technologies. The team will be required to perform fieldwork, visiting the various DCAS-managed buildings to replace the hardware and address issues, where necessary. MANDATORY SKILLS/EXPERIENCE Note: Candidates who do not have the mandatory skills will not be considered • At least 12 years of experience in an IT network engineering/ Technician role • Must demonstrate strong understanding complex Routing & Switching Environments • Must possess strong experience with Meraki, Firewalls, DNA and ISE • Ability to work independently is critical. • Some amount of physical work expected for installation and cabling. • Experience in implementing network patches. • Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. • Position is client facing. Strong Customer Support and interpersonal skills are required. DESIRABLE SKILLS/EXPERIENCE: N/A • Cisco WLAN and ISE specific experience desired • Understanding of Meraki Wi-Fi deployment, VPN Certificates and wireless routers • Working knowledge of ITL processes, specifically Incident Management, Change Management, Problem Management • Active CCNA certification preferred.
title: Network Infrastructure Engineer

description: Description: My wife and I seek an experienced Kitchen and Bath Interior Designer to help us create a cohesive and functional design for our upcoming renovation. This project focuses on a like-for-like remodel of three spaces: the kitchen (including a dining area), master bathroom, and guest bathroom. Our goal is to refresh these areas with updated finishes and fixtures while reusing existing elements where possible, all in a transitional modern style that reflects our preferences as a couple in our mid-40s to mid-50s. We need clear documentation and detailed plans to provide to contractors for seamless execution, as well as an item inventory list to streamline the renovation process. Scope of Work: Primary Bathroom (16x11 ft): Walk-in shower Soaking tub 12-ft vanity with double sinks Toilet room Kitchen (with Dining Area): Reusing current cabinetry (with potential refinishing or repainting options) Updating countertops, flooring, backsplash, and fixtures Guest Bathroom (3-piece): Bathtub, vanity, and toilet Incorporate the existing bathtub into the updated design Deliverables: Detailed Floor Plans: Precise layouts for each space, showing the placement of fixtures, cabinets, and other elements. 3D Renderings: Realistic visualizations of the updated kitchen, primary bathroom, and guest bathroom to illustrate the final design. Material and Fixture Recommendations: Suggestions for flooring, tile, countertops, hardware, and paint. Recommendations for cost-effective options to match the transitional modern aesthetic. Lighting Plan: Recommendations for task, ambient, and decorative lighting to enhance each space. Contractor-Ready Schematics: Professional-grade documentation with clear instructions and measurements for tradespeople to follow. Item Inventory List: Comprehensive list of all ordered materials, fixtures, and finishes. Details of delivery dates, quantities, and where each item should be used in the renovation. Installation Notes: Highlight special installation instructions (e.g., tile patterns, grout colors, or edge details). Budget-Friendly Alternatives: Include cost-saving suggestions for materials or design changes to help stay within budget while maintaining the desired aesthetic. Maintenance-Friendly Suggestions: Since this is a renovation project for a busy household, recommend durable and easy-to-maintain materials and finishes. Timeline Expectations: Preferred Timeline for Deliverables: Complete the first draft and final designs by 12/27. Incentive: We are open to offering a bonus for delivering high-quality work ahead of schedule if the timeline is met without compromising quality. What We’re Looking For: Designers with proven experience in kitchen and bath projects, particularly in the transitional modern style. Expertise in creating contractor-ready documents (e.g., layouts, schematics, and detailed plans). Creative ideas for incorporating existing elements like cabinetry and bathtubs into a refreshed design. Proficiency in design tools such as AutoCAD, SketchUp, or similar software. Working efficiently with provided photos, measurements, and minimal revisions. What We Do NOT Need: Space planning or structural changes (this is a like-for-like remodel). Mood boards or elaborate design presentations. Assistance with shopping or project management during the construction phase. Submission Requirements: If you’re interested in this project, please provide the following: Examples of similar projects you’ve completed. An estimated timeline for completing the designs and deliverables. A brief overview of your experience with kitchen and bathroom remodels. We’re excited to begin this project and look forward to collaborating with the right designer to transform our kitchen and bathrooms into beautiful, functional spaces. Let us know how you can help! Thank you!
title: Kitchen and Bath Interior Designer Needed for Renovation Project

description: HIPAA Compliance and Strategy Consultant Needed for SBIR Grant Proposal Job Description: We seek an experienced HIPAA Compliance Consultant for an SBIR application to the National Cancer Institute (NCI). Background: We are developing innovative new artificial intelligence (AI) software that automatically detects cancer from endoscopic ultrasound images. The software will be designed for early detection of cancer, and supports decision making by the physician. We submitted an application to the NIH in Sept 2024, where it received a strong score just outside of funding range. One of the reviewers suggested we add a HIPAA consultant to better understand regulatory compliance related to the software. Objective: You will review our application and provide input from a compliance regulatory perspective, including HIPAA. This will probably be a few hours of effort, to comment on our application which is being rebusmitted in Jan 5 , 2025. If the grant is funded, you will also have an opportunity to be part of the project, providing consultative input. About: Our software facilitates the secure exchange of patient data from image software to interface with physician, and is designed for use by endoscopist providers in the United States. We require guidance on privacy, security, and risk management requirements, along with support in documentation and audits. Key Responsibilities Grant Pre-Award: * Conduct a thorough assessment of our software for HIPAA compliance. * Provide an NIH style biosketch to award * Sit in on a few meetings to understand regulatory issues with the proposal * Review, edit, and/or comment on the proposal from regulatory perspective Post Award (If Funded): * Develop and document policies and procedures to meet HIPAA Privacy and Security Rule requirements. * Advise on implementing administrative, physical, and technical safeguards. * Assist in conducting a risk assessment and creating a risk management plan. * Provide training and education materials for our team to ensure ongoing compliance. * Offer support for any potential HIPAA audits or inquiries. Qualifications: * Proven experience in HIPAA compliance consulting. * Strong knowledge of HIPAA Privacy, Security, and Breach Notification Rules. * Experience working with healthcare software or technology companies. * Excellent communication and documentation skills. * Ability to work collaboratively with software developers, legal teams, and management. Preferred: * Certifications such as CHPC (Certified in Healthcare Privacy Compliance) or CIPP/US. * Experience with other healthcare compliance frameworks (e.g., HITECH, GDPR). * Prior NIH grants, SBIRs, STTRs, R grants * Publications accessible via PubMed Project Details: * Pre-Award: Now until Jan 5, 2025 * Post-Award: May 2025 and beyond Please submit: * Your resume, or bio * Your NIH style biosketch * Prior grants you have been involved with * Prior projects related to this one * Experience in developing decision support software, and/or AI that interacts with clinicians
title: HIPAA Consultant for NIH SBIR submission - Imaging Decision Support

description: ONLY DEVELOPERS IN THE UNITED STATES. FLUENT OR NATIVE ENGLISH ONLY. STRONG COMMUNICATION SKILLS. We're seeking an experienced React developer to implement a pluggable UI layout system for LibreChat (https://github.com/danny-avila/LibreChat), an open-source chat application. The goal is to create a configuration-based UI system that allows users to customize layouts while maintaining the ability to pull upstream updates. Key Requirements: + Implement a UI layout configuration system that separates presentation from core logic + Create a plugin/theme system for hot-swappable layouts + Ensure compatibility with Microsoft Azure deployment + Maintain proper TypeScript typing throughout the implementation + Document the system thoroughly for future contributors Required Technical Skills: + 5+ years of React development experience + Strong TypeScript knowledge Experience with: + Next.js + Azure deployment and services + Node.js/Express + MongoDB + Docker + Git/GitHub workflow + Building plugin/theme systems + Writing technical documentation Deliverables: 1. Implementation of layout configuration system 2. Documentation for: + System architecture + How to create custom layouts + Deployment instructions 3. At least one alternative layout example 4. Unit tests for new components 5. Azure deployment configuration To Apply, Please Provide: + Your experience with similar plugin/theme systems + Examples of open-source contributions + Brief proposal on how you would approach this implementation + Estimated timeline for completion + Previous experience with Azure deployments + Link to your GitHub profile Questions to Answer in Your Proposal: + How would you handle backward compatibility? + What approach would you take to minimize merge conflicts for forked repositories? + How would you structure the configuration files? + What testing strategy would you implement? Project Timeline: 1-2 weeks Additional Notes: + Must be willing to sign appropriate contributor agreements + Must be comfortable with open-source development practices + Regular progress updates and communication required + Code must follow the project's existing standards and practices + Experience with AI/chat applications is a plus The ideal candidate will have demonstrable experience building modular React applications and a strong understanding of software architecture principles. They should be able to balance flexibility with maintainability in their design decisions. Please note that all code will be open source and must adhere to the project's licensing requirements. Candidates who understand the existing LibreChat codebase and can provide specific examples of how they would implement this feature while maintaining the project's current capabilities and performance will be given preference. ////////////////// IMPLEMENTATION PLAN \\\\\\\\\\\\\\ ++++ Milestone 1: Initial Setup and Architecture (3 Days) ++++ Deliverables: Project architecture documentation Configuration file structure design Basic plugin system infrastructure Development environment setup with TypeScript configuration Acceptance Criteria: Approved architecture documentation Working development environment with TypeScript Initial configuration system structure GitHub workflow integration Payment: 25% of total budget ++++ Milestone 2: Core Layout System Implementation (4 Days) ++++ Deliverables: Base layout component system Layout configuration parser Hot-swappable theme mechanism Initial unit tests Integration with existing LibreChat components Acceptance Criteria: Functioning layout switching capability Successful integration with existing codebase Passing unit tests No regression in existing functionality Payment: 30% of total budget ++++ Milestone 3: Alternative Layout and Documentation (4 Days) ++++ Deliverables: One complete alternative layout implementation Comprehensive documentation including: System architecture guide Custom layout creation guide Configuration file documentation Azure deployment instructions Additional unit tests and integration tests Acceptance Criteria: Working alternative layout Complete documentation approved by project maintainers All tests passing Successful local testing of layout switching Payment: 25% of total budget ++++ Milestone 4: Deployment and Final Integration (3 Days) ++++ Deliverables: Azure deployment configuration Production-ready code with optimizations Final testing results Pull request ready for review Video demonstration of the system Acceptance Criteria: Successful Azure deployment All features working in a development and production environment Approved pull request Documentation fully updated with deployment details Payment: 20% of total budget Additional Requirements Throughout All Milestones: Daily progress updates via the agreed communication channel Code review feedback implementation Regular commits with clear commit messages Adherence to existing code style and practices Maintaining backward compatibility Regular testing to ensure no regression ++++ Timeline Summary ++++ Total Duration: 14 days Milestone 1: Days 1-3 Milestone 2: Days 4-7 Milestone 3: Days 8-11 Milestone 4: Days 12-14
title: Senior React Developer - UI Layout Swap System for Open Source Chat App

description: About The Business: I own a power equipment dealership, and we have a niche selling top of the line pre-owned $6,000-$9,000/ea. commercial grade zero turn mowers. The bottleneck we are running into is it is just me that is able to Source inventory because there is no Kelly Blue Book, or NADA, for mowers and only I know the market because I've studied it, and specialized in only this for the past 4 years. This is a market that only I know, and need to be able to translate that knowledge to other employees to delegate this task, and allow us to scale further. PS: I know very little about software development. End Goal: I want to have a system built where an employee can plug in what kind of mower they are looking at purchasing for the dealership, it's given specs (Like: Make/Model/Deck Width/Hours/Engine Make/Engine HP, Cosmetic Condition Rating/Expected Problems...etc), and it tell them how much we can afford to pay for it. Please note, this does NOT need to be EXTREMELY sophisticated- I want to get a "prototype/beta" going first that only we use in house to purchase inventory within a reasonable budget, then re-fine further from there after its been used. I want to be very clear, we are not in the pursuit of creating a system that is a bandaid fix, we are wanting to compete at a high level, and are in the pursuit of excellence, and high talent. It MUST be a system that employees can interact with, that removes the risk of making a bad purchasing decision, that is easy to train someone on, and that can be easily scaled to more and more purchasing reps in the dealership.
title: Business Systems Developer

description: Looking for a software tester to test various web and mobile applications. We do several projects throughout the year, and only need help for testing every other month or so, so for this job posting, we're looking for the right person that we can reach out to when we have a testing need, and they can step in, learn the product, and work with the dev team to get the testing done and the product validated. Typical workflow: 1. Read product documentation for new features/changes/other specs 2. Meet with Product Owner to discuss motivations, specs, answer questions, etc. 3. When dev team delivers a product, test it against specs, common sense, etc. 4. Document any usability issues, bugs, typo's, etc. 5. Wait for dev team to fix everything reported 6. Repeat steps 3-5 until product meets specifications 80% of the time, the product will just require using a website, entering information, manipulating information, etc. 20% of the time more complicated testing will be required such as using tools like Postman to generate web requests against an API. To do this, you should understand how web requests work, the basics of web authentication (e.g. OAuth, JWT, etc.), and also be able to work with SQL and document databases to perform basic queries.

description: I'm looking for a male voiceover artist to record ~1:15 of audio for a corporate video that shows how a new technology works. I need a confident and articulate voice. Here is the transcript for the video: ===================== Avalon's technology is a proprietary software platform for automating factories and manufacturing processes. Combined with robotics, vision, sensors, and AI, the software actively manages the factory and its equipment, integrating everything into one seamless flow. We call our software the Manufacturing Operating System, or M-O-S for short. Here is one example of how Avalon helps manufacturers achieve end-to-end automation. The M-O-S uses computer vision to find the correct piece of raw material. The robot grabs the raw material and places it into the C-N-C machine. With safety checks complete, the M-O-S then remotely starts the CNC machine. Any number of machines can be integrated into the M-O-S for concurrent production. When the CNC machine cycle is complete, the part is cleaned, marked with a laser, inspected with AI vision, and measured by the Coordinate Measurement Machine. Dozens of sensors and cameras throughout the process give the M-O-S feedback that allows it to monitor, manage and optimize every aspect of production. This is just one example of the infinite possibilities of how the Manufacturing Operating System can be rapidly deployed to build fully automation manufacturing. Partner with Avalon to unlock the potential of your manufacturing.
title: Male Voiceover Artist Needed

description: **Job Description:** We are excited to announce an opportunity for a highly skilled and detail-oriented Bookkeeper and Tax Professional to join our dynamic financial team, responsible for managing the financial operations of our esteemed network of three bustling restaurants. This position is crucial to ensuring that our financial practices align with industry standards and regulatory requirements while supporting the overall growth and success of our restaurants. Also providing our management team with weekly/monthly goals would be a major plus. We use Quickbooks online. The ideal candidate will possess substantial experience in bookkeeping and tax preparation, particularly in the hospitality industry. We are looking for someone with a deep understanding of the IRS regulations and a proven ability to navigate complex tax situations. Experience with international tax regulations will be considered an advantageous asset, as we occasionally engage in transactions that cross international borders. In this multifaceted role, your primary responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: 1. **Bookkeeping:** - Maintaining accurate financial records for all three restaurant locations, including daily transaction entries, accounts payable and receivable, and payroll processing. - Reconciling bank statements and ensuring all financial activities are documented in compliance with accounting standards. - Generating financial reports that provide insight into the performance of each restaurant, including profit and loss statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements. 2. **Tax Preparation:** - Preparing and filing federal, state, and local tax returns for each restaurant in a timely manner, ensuring compliance with all relevant tax laws and regulations. - Conducting thorough reviews of financial documents to identify any potential tax deductions and credits that can benefit the restaurants. - Keeping abreast of changes in tax laws and regulations, implementing necessary adjustments to our financial practices. 3. **Financial Advising:** - Collaborating with restaurant management to provide financial insights and recommendations that support strategic decision-making. - Assisting in budgeting and forecasting processes to help guide the financial future of our restaurants. - Offering guidance on financial planning and investment opportunities to enhance profitability and operational efficiency. As a candidate, you will need to demonstrate a high level of proficiency in accounting software and possess excellent analytical skills, allowing you to interpret financial data and make sound recommendations. Strong communication skills are essential, as you will be interacting with restaurant managers and staff, as well as external stakeholders, including auditors and tax authorities. If you are a motivated and organized individual with a strong attention to detail and a proven track record in financial management within the restaurant industry, we would love to hear from you. Join us in our mission to provide exceptional dining experiences while ensuring our financial health and compliance. We look forward to welcoming a new member to our team who shares our passion for excellence and commitment to success. We are looking for someone committed and that wants to build a longstanding relationship between our two companies.
title: Experienced Bookkeeper and Tax Professional Needed for Restaurant Network

Scripting and Automation: Strong scripting skills in Python or a similar language to automate processes and workflows. Infrastructure-as-Code: Practical experience with Terraform, Terragrunt, and Kubernetes for managing cloud-native infrastructure. Monitoring & Troubleshooting: Expertise in setting up monitoring services and managing production incidents in cloud-native environments. Fault Tolerance: Strong knowledge of designing, implementing, and managing fault-tolerant cloud-native solutions. Certifications (Preferred): AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or similar certifications. Soft Skills: Excellent communication, problem-solving abilities, and a proactive, collaborative approach to remote team environments. Experience in deployment version control management Cloud cost management and monitoring Project Scope & Commitment Part-Time: Flexible hours based on project milestones and deliverables. Project-Based: Focused engagements with clear objectives, timelines, and deliverables. What We Offer Competitive compensation for part-time/project-based work. Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and impactful projects. Potential for ongoing collaborations and extended engagements.

description: Description: We are a medical device manufacturer based in Southern California specializing in designing and producing innovative devices for rehabilitation ( cryotherapy, laser, shockwaves...). Requirements: • Proven experience in mechanical design engineering, with a focus on medical devices or a similar regulated industry. • Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, AutoCAD, or similar). • Strong understanding of medical device compliance standards (FDA regulations, ISO 13485, IEC 60601, or equivalent). • Experience working with prototyping techniques and transitioning designs to production. • Excellent collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with multidisciplinary teams. • Knowledge of manufacturing processes and materials specific to the medical device industry. • Project management experience is a plus. Preferred Qualifications: • Based in or willing to work remotely with teams in Southern California. The plant is located in Carlsbad and engineers are in between Carlsbad and Anaheim, driving distance from either of those location is a plus. • Familiarity with rehabilitation-focused devices is a bonus. Why Join Us? You’ll be part of a team that is making a tangible difference in rehabilitation care, helping patients achieve better outcomes. Please provide a brief overview of your relevant experience, a portfolio of past work, and your availability.

You will also play a critical role in fostering smooth collaboration within our global team, managing across time zones and diverse backgrounds. Training Program Design & Optimization Design and implement training programs to improve the performance and skills of livestream hosts. Global Team Collaboration Work effectively within an international team, managing communication and coordination across diverse cultural backgrounds and time zones. Execution & Operations Execute operational HR tasks with exceptional attention to detail, including onboarding, performance tracking, and payroll support for part-time and contract team members. Communication & Stakeholder Management Maintain clear, effective communication with multiple stakeholders across leadership, operations, and recruitment teams. Act as a liaison to ensure alignment on hiring strategies, training outcomes, and HR processes. Requirement 1. Must be a Christian who shares and aligns with our faith-driven mission and values. 2. Minimum of 3 years’ experience in recruitment, HR operations, or a similar role. 3. Experience in the software/IT industry is highly preferred. 4. Proven experience in building candidate personas and hiring strategies from scratch using data-driven approaches. 5. Experience in designing and implementing training programs with measurable results. 6. Strong ability to work with international teams across different time zones, with flexibility for occasional evening meetings. 7. Exceptional execution skills with a proactive, organized, and detail-oriented mindset. 8. Outstanding communication skills with the ability to manage relationships across multiple stakeholders. description: Industrial UI/UX Designer Needed for Innovative Machinery Interface We are seeking a talented Industrial UI/UX Designer to help us craft a cutting-edge user interface for a new piece of industrial machinery. This machine features a digital screen and requires an intuitive, user-friendly interface that simplifies operation and enhances customer experience. As our UI/UX Designer, you will focus on creating an interface that bridges the gap between traditional industrial design and modern digital interaction. Your role will involve applying UX design principles to physical industrial products, ensuring seamless integration between the machine’s physical controls and its digital touch-based interactions. Key Responsibilities: User-Centered Design: Develop a user-friendly and intuitive interface for operating the machine, ensuring the design meets customer needs. Integration: Design a digital interface that complements the physical aspects of the machinery. Industrial Focus: Address unique challenges associated with industrial equipment, such as durability, functionality, and ease of use in rugged environments. Requirements: Proven experience in UI/UX design, preferably in the industrial sector. Strong understanding of human-machine interface (HMI) design principles. description: We’re seeking a QuickBooks-savvy bookkeeper who can help us clean up and reconcile our payroll transactions. Requirements: Proven experience in bookkeeping or accounting, with a strong focus on U.S. payroll. Excellent proficiency in QuickBooks Online, specifically handling payroll journal entries. Please share your relevant experience and any examples of past payroll cleanup projects you’ve successfully tackled.

description: We’re seeking an experienced developer (or team) to build an AI-powered software tool that streamlines the grant application process. Responsibilities: Develop a grant search feature integrated with APIs (e.g., Grants.gov) or web scraping tools. Strong proficiency in Python (TensorFlow, PyTorch, or OpenAI APIs). Backend development skills (Flask, Django, or Node.js). Frontend expertise in React.js, Vue.js, or Angular. Familiarity with web scraping tools (e.g., BeautifulSoup, Scrapy) and API integration. Experience with cloud deployment and scalability solutions. Preferred Skills: Knowledge of grant or nonprofit industries. Experience building SaaS platforms. Budget/Compensation: [Specify your budget range or "Open to discussion."] How to Apply: Share your portfolio or GitHub link. Describe a similar project you’ve worked on and your role in it. Include your availability and expected compensation. Step 2: Posting the Job Post this job on platforms like: Upwork, Freelancer: For freelancers or small teams. LinkedIn, AngelList: For individual professionals or full-time hires. Toptal, Fiverr: For pre-vetted experts or specialized tasks. Step 3: Interview Process Here’s a step-by-step interview plan: 1. Initial Screening (15-20 minutes) Objective: Assess their understanding of your project and check for alignment. Questions to Ask: What interests you about this project? Can you describe your experience with similar tools or AI-based solutions? Do you have examples of projects with AI model integration? 2. Technical Assessment (1-2 hours) Objective: Evaluate their technical skills. Tasks: For AI Models: Ask them to build a simple text generation or classification model using GPT. For APIs/Web Scraping: Have them write code to scrape data from a sample grant page. 3. Deep Dive Interview (30-60 minutes) Objective: Understand their problem-solving approach and collaboration style. Questions to Ask: How would you approach building the grant-writing tool? What challenges do you foresee, and how would you solve them? Can you explain a time when you worked with a tight deadline or complex requirements? 4. Portfolio/Code Review Review their past work on GitHub or other platforms. Look for clean, documented, and scalable code. Step 4: Finalizing the Hire Contract: Draft a clear contract with milestones, deliverables, and payment terms. Tools for Collaboration: Project Management: Trello, Asana, or Jira. Code Collaboration: GitHub or GitLab. Communication: Slack, Zoom.

Strong communication skills and attention to detail are essential. Experience in the construction industry is a plus, but not mandatory. If you are proactive and can multitask effectively in a dynamic environment, we would love to hear from you! Position Summary: 1. Project Support: - Provide administrative assistance to the Project Manager and Superintendent for project-related tasks. - Prepare, issue, and manage subcontracts while ensuring proper documentation. 2. Billing and Cost Administration: - Prepare and process billings for subcontractors and owners. - Accurately input cost and billing data into the accounting system (Infor). 3. Document and File Management: - Maintain well-organized physical and digital project files. - Ensure all documents are digitized and properly archived. 4. Change order Management: - Collaborate with the Project Manager on change order processes and related updates. 5. ;System Coordination: - Ensure synchronization between jobsite management software (e.g., Procore) and the accounting system. 6. Meeting Support: - Assist in scheduling, preparing materials, and setting up for project meetings. 7. Vendor and Subcontractor Coordination: - Distribute payments to subcontractors and vendors. - Manage compliance processes for Notices to Owner (NTO), lien waivers, and Notices of Commencement (NOC). 8. Jobsite Operations: - Oversee jobsite utilities, connectivity, cleaning services, supplies, and related payments. 9. Closeout and Warranty Management: - Support the Project Manager in managing project closeout activities and warranty processes.

description: Hello! We’re Precise Mind Behavioral Health, and we’re thrilled to find a motivated, organized, and people-focused professional to join our team as a Client Engagement & Lead Management Specialist. This role is all about connecting with new clients, guiding them through their onboarding journey, and ensuring they feel supported from their first contact with us. If you’re passionate about helping people, have a knack for organization, and enjoy working independently with a friendly, client-centered team, we’d love to meet you! Here's a bit more about what the role involves and how we like to work together. Expectations: Task Deliverables: Your main tasks include managing new client leads by verifying and entering information, scheduling consultations, following up with leads, and maintaining accurate records in Therapy Notes. You’ll also handle daily email management and assist with various administrative tasks to support a seamless client experience. Timely Follow-Ups: Follow-up calls, emails, and automated messages should be conducted within specific time frames, and all client information should be updated promptly in the onboarding spreadsheet. Accuracy and Confidentiality: It’s crucial to handle client information accurately and in compliance with HIPAA standards, ensuring confidentiality at all times. Skills Required: Customer Service: Strong interpersonal and communication skills, especially on phone calls and in follow-up messages. Sales: Ability to use sales techniques to encourage leads to book consultations or appointments. Data Management: Proficiency in Therapy Notes, Google Sheets, and HIPAA-compliant email platforms. Organization: Strong organizational skills to keep track of multiple clients at different stages. Tech Savvy: Familiarity with automation tools (e.g., Zapier) and calendar/scheduling software. Communication: Daily Updates: We expect clear daily updates on lead statuses and task progress through email or a shared project management tool. Check-Ins: During daily check-in times, report any issues or questions that arise. We're available for quick questions throughout the day via email or messaging. Response Time: Aim to respond to team messages and client inquiries within an hour during business hours. Our Workflow: Independent Work: We value independent work and trust our team to manage tasks efficiently with minimal oversight. Structured Daily Schedule: Your day will be divided into check-in sessions for lead monitoring and data entry (e.g., 9:30 AM, 12:00 PM, 3:00 PM, 5:30 PM). Central Time Zone Clear Processes: Detailed guidelines and workflows are provided for each stage of the lead management process. Our team uses Therapy Notes and Google Sheets extensively, so familiarity with these platforms is ideal. Team Meetings: Regular check-ins are held weekly for updates, feedback, and discussing any adjustments needed in the workflow. This setup ensures a streamlined client experience, making the onboarding process efficient and organized. If you’re detail-oriented, communicative, and comfortable working in a structured, independent role, we’d love to have you on our team!
title: Client Engagement & Lead Management Specialist for Telehealth Practice

description: Project Overview: We are seeking a skilled Python developer to integrate an existing idiCORE API into an Apache Airflow 2.10.2 orchestrated ETL pipeline. The successful candidate will design, develop, and deploy the integration, ensuring seamless data flow between the idiCORE API, Postgres databases, and Odoo CRM. 1. Responsibilities API Integration: - Integrate the idiCORE API into the existing Airflow pipeline using Python. - Handle API calls to populate database fields with contact information for individuals based on name, address, and/or phone number. Data Transformation: - Utilize Pydantic and SQLAlchemy to transform data from the idiCORE API response into a format suitable for storage in the Odoo CRM Postgres database. Database Integration: - Ensure data is stored correctly in the Odoo CRM Postgres database using SQLAlchemy. Error Handling and Logging: - Implement robust error handling mechanisms to handle any issues that may arise during API calls or data transformation. - Configure logging to track pipeline performance and errors. Security and Authentication: - Ensure proper authentication and authorization mechanisms are in place for the idiCORE API integration. Testing and Quality Assurance: - Develop comprehensive test cases to validate the integration's functionality and performance. 2. Requirements Technical Skills: - Proficiency in Python (3.x) and familiarity with Airflow 2.10.2. - Experience with Postgres, Pydantic, SQLAlchemy, and Odoo CRM. - Knowledge of idiCORE API and its requirements (nice-to-have). Experience: - Previous experience with ETL pipelines, data integration, and API integrations. Soft Skills: - Strong understanding of software development principles, best practices, and design patterns. - Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment. 3. Deliverables - A fully functional, tested, and documented integration of the idiCORE API into the Airflow pipeline. - A comprehensive understanding of the project's architecture, data flows, and security measures. - A detailed report outlining any issues encountered during development, testing, or deployment. 4. Timeline The current expected completion date is January 1st, 2025. However, we may alter the project timeline based on changes in scope, complexity, and available resources. 5. Evaluation Criteria - Technical proficiency and expertise. - Quality of code, documentation, and overall project delivery. - Adherence to project requirements, timelines, and security guidelines.
title: Integrate idiCORE API into Apache Airflow orchestrated ETL pipeline

description: Job Description: We are seeking a dynamic and self-motivated Remote Sales Representative to join our team as the first dedicated sales professional. This individual will play a pivotal role in driving revenue growth by taking ownership of all sales-related activities, from lead generation to closing deals. As a proactive go-getter, the ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive sales strategy, identifying new business opportunities, and building relationships with prospective clients. Responsibilities: • Develop and implement a comprehensive sales strategy to drive revenue growth and meet sales targets. • Generate and qualify leads through research, outreach, and networking. • Build and manage a pipeline of prospective clients, identifying key decision-makers and stakeholders. • Conduct outbound sales activities, including cold calling, email outreach, and social media engagement. • Present and demonstrate the company’s products/services to prospective clients, highlighting value and benefits. • Manage the entire sales cycle, from initial contact to negotiation and contract closure. • Collaborate with internal teams to ensure smooth onboarding and client satisfaction. • Track and report on sales activities, performance metrics, and revenue forecasts. • Stay up to date with industry trends and market developments to identify new opportunities. • Provide feedback to leadership on market needs and potential product enhancements. Qualifications: • Proven experience in a sales role, preferably in a startup or small team environment. • Demonstrated ability to generate leads, build a sales pipeline, and close deals independently. • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a talent for building relationships. • Self-motivated, results-driven, and comfortable working in a remote environment. • Strong organizational and time-management skills to manage multiple priorities effectively. • Proficiency with CRM software, sales automation tools, and communication platforms. • Experience in cold calling, email campaigns, and other outreach methods. • Familiarity with the industry or target market is a plus but not required. Benefits: • Competitive base salary with performance-based commissions. • Flexible, fully remote work environment. Opportunity to grow with the company and shape the sales function. • Direct impact on company growth and success. • Possible stock options This position offers a unique opportunity to build and lead the sales function from the ground up. If you are a driven sales professional ready to take on the challenge of generating new business and driving revenue growth, we want to hear from you!

description: We are looking for a talented Full Stack Developer with expertise in Ruby, Python, React, Redux, and AWS to collaborate on an exciting project. This role is ideal for a freelancer with a proven track record of developing scalable and user-friendly web applications. You'll work closely with our team to design, develop, and deploy high-quality software that meets both technical and business requirements. Key Responsibilities: Develop and maintain robust server-side applications using Ruby (Rails preferred) and Python. Build dynamic and responsive front-end interfaces using React and Redux. Design, implement, and optimize APIs for seamless integration between front-end and back-end systems. Manage and deploy cloud-based solutions on AWS, leveraging services such as EC2, S3, Lambda, and RDS. Collaborate with team members to troubleshoot and resolve technical challenges. Deliver clean, maintainable, and well-documented code within project deadlines. Requirements: Strong experience in Ruby on Rails and Python development. Proficiency in building front-end applications using React and Redux. Solid understanding of AWS cloud architecture and hands-on experience deploying applications in a cloud environment. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to debug complex technical issues. Familiarity with version control systems (Git) and collaborative workflows. Experience with Agile development practices is a plus. Scope: The project involves the development of a robust authorization module for a Medicare system. This module will ensure secure access control for users, providing role-based and permission-based authentication. Key functionalities include: User registration and login with multi-factor authentication. Role-based access control (RBAC) for healthcare providers, administrators, and patients. Integration with an existing Medicare database for seamless user management. Session management with token-based authentication (e.g., OAuth2/JWT). Logging and monitoring of user activities for security compliance. Implementation of industry-standard security practices (e.g., HIPAA compliance). Communication: Daily collaboration and queries through Skype.
title: Full Stack Developer (Ruby, Python, React, Redux, AWS)

description: We are a small ISP and have 7 different systems that we use to manage the network. I've struggled with getting the authentication working properly. In one case, the client credentials workflow does not update the OAUTH2_TOKEN placeholder in the query. I can probably accomplish this with a custom workflow, but as I understand it, you cannot use those in workflows. This is foundational stuff for a tool that is supposed to allow you to write middleware via APIs, but I don't have the time to spend fighting with it. Once all of these APIs are authenticated and working, the first functionality I'd like to implement is to iterate through a list from one systems and make updates in another via a button. Secondly, a working example of a webhook to fire when events happen in the CRM. I think armed with this, I can begin creating useful functionality, but I'd like to have a resource I can depend on should I get in a bind. I have a background in software development as I used to own a software company, but that was about 10 years ago.
title: Initial setup for Retool internal application

description: ‘Seeking a short consult about a software testing project. The software operates a large complex machine, and includes four components: Python for comm & data transfer, C++ for processing, React for UX, and Linux for OS. The software is written, and localized Unit testing has been completed. All the software has now been installed on the big machine for Verification testing, so the software components now operate as an integrated system. My question focuses on observability. How does a ‘tester’ (a software engineer) evaluate the individual software components on the machine, determine that they’re working properly, w accurate outputs. The need is to evaluate the interactions between integrated components to verify overall system behavior. Assume complete physical access to everything--- unit test files, code base, etc. (note, the machine is not networked to cloud or anything,) I understand there are tools to monitor and visualize these operations discretely, with some granularity. Or maybe there are other ways? I need to know how to do this. Do you have any experience w this? Have you designed or run tests of integrated systems, with multiple software components? We can chat briefly, or go by email. I just need a detailed understanding of how this can be done.
title: Enterprise Software Testing - Need Short Consult

description: We’re looking for an Appsmith specialist who can help our team build, refine, and deploy custom forms and interfaces for a healthcare-related project. Contribute to an evolving hybrid environment of low-code platforms and traditional engineering tools. Potentially support future enhancements and projects, depending on performance and fit. description: Job Description: We are seeking an experienced developer to create a bot or automation tool that will scrape scheduling data from our existing medical software and sync it with a more user-friendly scheduling platform. Our current medical scheduling system is difficult to navigate, particularly on mobile devices, so we need a seamless way to view and manage appointments on an alternative platform. Responsibilities: • Analyze the current medical scheduling system to identify and extract relevant data. • Develop a bot/tool to scrape scheduling information and export it to the new platform. • Ensure the data syncs in real-time (or near real-time) between both platforms. • Implement features to handle conflicts or data discrepancies during syncing. • Provide user-friendly tools or documentation for ongoing management and troubleshooting. Requirements: • Proven experience in web scraping, automation, or bot development. • Familiarity with medical scheduling systems (preferred, but not required). • Strong understanding of APIs and integration between systems. • Ability to ensure data security and compliance with HIPAA (if applicable). • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Deliverables: • A fully functional bot/tool that syncs scheduling data between systems. • Documentation and training on how to use and maintain the tool. • Ongoing support for any bugs or improvements during the initial rollout period. Preferred Skills: • Experience with healthcare or medical software systems. • Knowledge of scheduling platforms and their APIs. • Ability to design user-friendly interfaces for mobile devices.
title: Develop a Bot to Sync Medical Scheduling System with User-Friendly Platform

description: About Us: At AstralTech Labs, we specialize in delivering customized AI and software solutions that tackle real business challenges. From automating time-consuming processes to optimizing operations and enhancing decision-making, we equip businesses with the tools to boost productivity and achieve sustainable growth. Our tailored solutions turn raw data into actionable insights, cut operational costs, and proactively mitigate risks through advanced predictive analytics. Job Summary: We are looking for a skilled Software Engineer to join our team and contribute to the design, development, and deployment of custom software solutions. The ideal candidate will have experience in full-stack development, a strong grasp of best practices, and a passion for writing clean, efficient code. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver projects that exceed client expectations. Responsibilities: * Develop and maintain web and mobile applications using modern programming languages (JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Kotlin, Swift, Go, Rust, or Dart). * Write clean, scalable, and efficient code while adhering to established standards and best practices. * Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing software and suggest enhancements to optimize functionality. * Deploy, manage, and monitor applications in cloud environments, utilizing DevOps practices to streamline continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. * Integrate AI and machine learning models into web applications. * Collaborate with QA teams to ensure high-quality software through rigorous testing, including automated testing and monitoring. * Monitor and optimize application performance, scalability, and reliability, proactively addressing any issues that arise in production. * Keep up-to-date with industry trends, technologies, and best practices to continuously improve our development process. Requirements: * Proven experience as a Software Engineer or similar role in a professional environment, preferably within a custom development agency. * Proficiency in full-stack development, including experience with any modern programming language (e.g., JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Kotlin, Swift, Go, Rust, or Dart). * Experience with modern frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js, Django, Flask, Flutter). * Strong understanding of databases, both SQL and NoSQL, and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud). * Familiarity with RESTful APIs, third-party integrations, and microservices architecture * Experience with version control systems, particularly Git, and CI/CD pipelines. * Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a proactive attitude. * Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment. AstralTech Labs is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

description: Hello, Our Content Creator Management Agency is looking for a Financial Manager who can help with the following - put together monthly reports for each client's P&L - Assist with Payroll - Maintain financial records and monthly P&L - Assist with Financial Analysis Below is a more in depth job description please share your relevant experience when applying Reports To: Founder About Us: Model Starz is a leading marketing agency specializing in innovative strategies and creative solutions for our diverse client base. Our team is passionate about driving results and delivering exceptional value to our clients. We are seeking a skilled Financial Manager to join our dynamic team and oversee the financial health and growth of our agency. Job Overview: As the Financial Manager at Model Starz, you will play a pivotal role in managing the agency’s financial operations, including budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, and compliance. You will work closely with the Founder to develop financial strategies that support the agency’s growth objectives and ensure the efficient allocation of resources. Your expertise will be essential in optimizing financial performance and providing insights that guide decision-making. Key Responsibilities: Financial Planning & Analysis: Develop and manage the agency’s annual budget, including revenue projections, expense planning, and cash flow management. Financial Reporting: Prepare and present monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports to Founder, providing insights and recommendations based on financial data. Cost Management: Monitor and control costs across departments, ensuring efficient use of resources and alignment with budgetary goals. Revenue Management: Analyze revenue streams, client profitability, and project margins to identify opportunities for growth and optimization. Compliance & Risk Management: Ensure compliance with all financial regulations, tax requirements, and internal policies. Identify and manage financial risks, implementing mitigation strategies as needed. Payroll & Invoicing: Oversee the payroll process, ensuring accuracy and timely payments. Manage invoicing and accounts receivable to maintain healthy cash flow. Financial Strategy: Collaborate with senior management to develop financial strategies that support the agency’s long-term objectives and business development efforts. Audit Coordination: Lead the preparation for internal and external audits, ensuring all financial records are accurate and up to date. Vendor & Client Relations: Manage financial relationships with vendors, clients, and other stakeholders, including contract negotiations and payment terms. Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a small finance team, providing guidance and support to ensure high performance and professional growth. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field. A Master’s degree or professional certification (e.g., CPA, CFA) is preferred. 5+ years of experience in financial management, preferably within a marketing or creative agency. Strong knowledge of financial principles, accounting standards, and financial regulations. Proficiency in financial management software (e.g., QuickBooks, Xero, Excel) and reporting tools. Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present financial information clearly and concisely. Experience in budgeting, forecasting, and financial modeling. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in a marketing or creative agency environment. Knowledge of project-based accounting and client billing processes. Familiarity with digital marketing metrics and their financial implications. What We Offer: Competitive salary and benefits package. A collaborative and creative work environment. Opportunities for professional development and career advancement. Flexible work arrangements.

description: Information Security Leadership Collaborate with the CSO or designated committee to implement cybersecurity policies, strategies, and best practices across the organization. Assist in defining and documenting clear security responsibilities, including succession plans for the CSO role. Vendor Security Risk Management (VSRM) Develop and oversee a Vendor Security Risk Management (VSRM) program, including: Evaluating vendor criticality and risk. Establishing vendor monitoring and compliance review processes. Ensuring vendors meet ThriveLink’s security and regulatory requirements. Work closely with vendors and subcontractors to ensure secure data handling practices. Phishing Tests and Security Awareness Implement regular phishing simulations for employees and contractors to enhance security awareness. Support the delivery of security training programs, including tracking training completion and identifying improvement areas. Cyber Liability Insurance Collaborate with leadership to evaluate and secure cyber liability insurance coverage. Assist in maintaining documentation related to insurance policies and claims. Secure Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Formalize and document a Secure SDLC process, ensuring it includes: Threat modeling. Secure coding standards. Code review practices. Collaborate with the development team to integrate security into all stages of the SDLC. Secure Code Scanning Implement routine secure code scanning and remediation practices to identify and address vulnerabilities. Ensure all code changes undergo security reviews before deployment. Customer-Facing Security Documentation Create and maintain customer-facing security documentation that provides clear instructions on product security settings, configurations, and implementation best practices. Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) Develop and maintain a comprehensive Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for all ThriveLink products to track third-party components and dependencies. Cloud Security Tools and Services Ensure the effective use of AWS native tools and third-party services to secure ThriveLink's cloud environment. Manage the implementation and monitoring of tools such as AWS CloudTrail, GuardDuty, and IAM. Disaster Recovery and Incident Response Regularly review and update the disaster recovery plan and incident response plan. Conduct annual tests and simulations to ensure readiness and identify gaps in the plans. Compliance Monitoring Monitor compliance with industry standards, including HIPAA and PCI-DSS, if applicable. Maintain documentation to support audit readiness and regulatory adherence. Performance Metrics and Reporting Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) for security practices and infrastructure performance. Provide regular reports to the CSO, CEO, and stakeholders on security program progress, risks, and metrics. IT Infrastructure Oversight Ensure the stability, scalability, and security of ThriveLink’s IT infrastructure, including telephonic AI platforms and cloud services. Collaborate with engineering teams to align IT operations with business needs. Project Management Lead cross-functional IT projects related to security, compliance, and infrastructure improvements. Ensure timely delivery of milestones and clear communication with stakeholders. Additional Skills and Qualifications Technical Expertise: Proficiency in cloud environments (AWS), secure software development practices, and vendor management tools. Regulatory Knowledge: Familiarity with HIPAA, NIST, GDPR, and other relevant security standards. Problem-Solving: Strong analytical skills to address security vulnerabilities, compliance issues, and operational inefficiencies. Communication: Ability to create clear documentation and communicate complex security concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

description: We are a small e-learning design and development agency looking for an individual freelance instructional designer (ID) to work with on an on-going basis in 2025. In terms of workload, project hours will vary at times, but will typically be anywhere from 5-20hrs. per week per project. Projects will be on-going throughout 2025, and our goal is to have an ID selected and ready to start the week of January 6th, 2025. Compensation is $40/hr. (minus UW's fees), and each project will have a maximum hours cap that all ID work must be completed within (this varies by project). Strong knowledge of, and proficiency with, instructional design, adult learning principles, excellent writing/editing skills, adherence to writing style guides, outlining, storyboarding, working effectively with SME(s), project/time management skills, responsive communication and the ability to adhere to deadlines is necessary to be successful in this role. description: We have need of a accounting professional (CPA) to perform tax advising, state and federal filing preparation, and filing for a small, unique healthcare provider organization with 3.2m gross revenue. We have a full charge bookkeeper, and only need tax advising, filing preparation, and filing support. Your role would be primarily interfacing with executive leadership and our outsourced bookkeeper for necessary financial reports and information required for tax advising, forms preparation, and filing requirements. Successful performance in this role may lead to a fractional CFO role. We use QuickBooks Online Pro as our accounting system. We also use other web based systems for remote communications and document storage and sharing: Dropbox, Teams, Office 365, etc. So familiarity with these and the ability to utilize and leverage technology to proactively communicate and maintain strong virtual connections to support and satisfy business processes is absolutely required. The entity that needs support, a California C-Corp, but was converted from a 501c6 Corporation in 2023, was formed in 2014 through an alliance with other individuals in our niche industry. The industry organization's mission was to provide infrastructure and deal flow to its members. It was initially funded through the purchase of one of the founding members for profit business assets, which had been in business for over 15 years. The purchase of assets from the for profit was conducted via a seller financed asset purchase agreement and note. The note was not paid, and in 2023 the sole remaining member (the original founding member who sold the for profit assets to the non-profit) decided to reorganize as a for profit to comply with IRS rules as it had to begin providing services directly to customers, instead of via its members. The reorganization, settlement & assignment agreement was conducted by our outside counsel, Ryan Woods, Esq., and filed with and accepted by the California Secretary of State. However, the organization's prior accountant failed to properly designate its 2022 990 filing as "final", so when counsel filed the IRS "reclassification" request, the IRS returned it as unprocessed, and the 2023 returns, although prepared, were not able to be filed as a for profit with the IRS. As such, the first task of the new accountancy should be to make the necessary amendments to the filed 990 return(s), work with counsel to obtain for profit reclassification by the IRS, then review and correct (if required) the drafted 2023 returns, and then file them. The organization, The National Phlebotomy Provider Network, Inc. operates in multiple metro markets in several states and specializes in medical and research specimen collection, processing and delivery services for a variety of customer constituencies. The company is both a B2C and a B2B venture with a very diverse customer constituency. The company utilizes a PEO employment model through ADP, so employer tax liabilities are managed by ADP.
